flow.descriptionCdata:
79ccff1b-a05b-4efa-b5ad-52d247825cbc.0630cd28-49be-4fba-a054-fa1d4c5da6d6.prompt=Process Instance ID 79ccff1b-a05b-4efa-b5ad-52d247825cbc.1077dd44-f837-4abc-9946-4bade2593089.prompt=User Identifier 79ccff1b-a05b-4efa-b5ad-52d247825cbc.121929b9-2aea-4bca-bffb-c8d11d95e689.description=This workflow adds/updates the component property using Artifact APIs. onlyUpdate\: yes/no yes - To update values of existing property (In this case input "valueType" is not required , This input will not be considered even if provided) no - To add/update property valueType - Value type of the property. It can have value from selection list "CSA-Property-ValueType". This Input is required only when Input "onlyUpdate" is selected as "no". values - One or more values dilimited by comma , (If user want to use some other separator for multiple values then needs to be pass as next input "separator") separator - A delimiter that separates elements in the values ( default dilimiter used is comma ,) 79ccff1b-a05b-4efa-b5ad-52d247825cbc.185f327c-8157-4aad-bdc2-7fec56797318.prompt=Process Instance ID 79ccff1b-a05b-4efa-b5ad-52d247825cbc.4ede2bb0-2a86-4e7a-a161-8bd7ec76bfb5.description=Changes a VM's power state. Must specify either hostSystem, clusterName, or vmResourcePool as a target location for VMs. Input Parameters\: vmName - name of the VM that will be created with this flow templateName - name of the VM template to clone in vCenter osType - linux or windows host - vCenter host to execute against user - vCenter username password - vCenter password vmDatacenter - target Datacenter on the vCenter host for the VMs dataStore - target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs clusterName - target cluster for the VMs vmResourcePool - target resource pool for the VMs vmPowerState - the desired power state (on / off etc) Responses\: success - if the command completes execution and its exit code is 0 failure - otherwise Result Fields\: serviceXml - xml representation of the server created in vCenter 79ccff1b-a05b-4efa-b5ad-52d247825cbc.56d52a9a-30b5-48fe-a382-dffea34b5b97.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
79ccff1b-a05b-4efa-b5ad-52d247825cbc.7044cbc9-35b8-42d3-bb40-13af8b63b404.description=This workflow returns the component properties and values using Artifact APIs. result\: propertyNameValuesList\: pipe separated list of property name and values ( where each property name and values would be ; seprated and multiple values would be , seprated) e.g. - property 1; value1,value2|property 2; value3|property 3; value3,value4|........ 79ccff1b-a05b-4efa-b5ad-52d247825cbc.76ffcb2a-ef0d-4508-ae1b-def459d90a75.prompt=Artifact ID 79ccff1b-a05b-4efa-b5ad-52d247825cbc.8e13f80d-33c7-446c-b3be-20bd159f042f.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 79ccff1b-a05b-4efa-b5ad-52d247825cbc.9486ae0d-9e48-4015-bd10-2936e5e2e70b.prompt=User Identifier 79ccff1b-a05b-4efa-b5ad-52d247825cbc.9d71410d-cf14-4391-bd0a-a95ede26120b.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 79ccff1b-a05b-4efa-b5ad-52d247825cbc.b72196b3-30de-43dc-b1b6-808c571d2a35.prompt=Component ID 79ccff1b-a05b-4efa-b5ad-52d247825cbc.b8aeeba9-55e2-42b1-87bb-d7d336af61f6.prompt=Resource Provider ID 79ccff1b-a05b-4efa-b5ad-52d247825cbc.d70bea59-ff21-41a1-96ca-a8c85f2339e8.prompt=User Identifier 79ccff1b-a05b-4efa-b5ad-52d247825cbc.description=
Stop the Virtual Machine

Inputs Parameters\:

 CSA_CONTEXT_ID – CSA Context Id
 CSA_PROCESS_ID – CSA Process Instance Id
 SVC_COMPONENT_ID - This token will resolve to the Service component Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\:SVC_COMPONENT_ID]
 RSC_PROVIDER_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource Provider Id that was selected at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\:RSC_PROVIDER_ID]
 SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_EMAIL - This token will resolve to the subscriber’s email address. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_EMAIL]
 RSC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource Subscription Id that was created from the Resource Offering at the Subscription time.
  		Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID]
 SVC_COMPONENT_TYPE - This token will resolve to the Service component type. Eg\: Server.. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_COMPONENT_TYPE]
 RSC_POOL_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource pool Id that was selected at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_POOL_ID]
 SVC_INSTANCE_ID - This token will resolve to the Service Instance Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_INSTANCE_ID]
 SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID - This token will resolve to the Subscription Id that was created at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID]
 PRN_COMPONENT_ID – This token will resolve to the parent Component’s Service Component Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: PRN_COMPONENT_ID]
 REQ_ORG_ID - This token will resolve to the Organization Id associated with the service request. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: REQ_ORG_ID]
 REQ_USER_ID - This token will resolve to the User Id associated with the service request. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: REQ_USER_ID]
 USR_ORG_ID - This token will resolve to the Organization Id associated with the subscriber. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: USR_ORG_ID]
 RSC_BINDING_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource Binding Id that was created at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_BINDING_ID]

Responses\:
 success - The operation completed successfully.
 failure - Something went wrong.
79ccff1b-a05b-4efa-b5ad-52d247825cbc.e5b6f496-abc4-4aa8-a15b-4cee39fa2e0f.prompt=Process Instance ID 79ccff1b-a05b-4efa-b5ad-52d247825cbc.e72b9b4a-17eb-4cc1-98da-d1cd21415477.prompt=User Identifier 79ccff1b-a05b-4efa-b5ad-52d247825cbc.e9564d81-b2f4-4570-82d0-b1c560de706c.prompt=User Identifier 79ccff1b-a05b-4efa-b5ad-52d247825cbc.ebb3e098-6f19-441c-8673-d97a213910dd.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 79ccff1b-a05b-4efa-b5ad-52d247825cbc.ee5436f6-ab16-4e97-a168-ed7be23f9348.prompt=User Identifier
flow.name: vCenter Stop Server
